sen.j: 能登内親王（のとのひめみこ、のとないしんのう、天平7年（733年） - 天応 (日本)元年（781年）2月17日 (旧暦)）は、奈良時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess NOTO no Himemiko (born in 735 - died March 20, 781) was a princess of imperial blood who lived in the Nara period.
The Imperial Princess Noto (735 - March 20, 781) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 名前の部分を修正しました。the を補いました。カッコ内を修正しました。princess of imperial blood→member of the Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Princess Noto (735 - March 20, 781) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived in the Nara period.
She was the first princess of Emperor Konin.
She was the first princess of Emperor Konin.
She was the first princess of Emperor Konin.
She was an older maternal half-sister of Emperor Kanmu.
She was an older sister-uterine of the Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。maternal half-sister→sister-uterine と修正しました。
sen.e: She was an older sister-uterine of the Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 733年、白壁王（後の光仁天皇）の王女として平城京に誕生。
sen.e: She was the princess born to Shirakabe no okimi (later Prince Shirakabe) in Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in modern Nara) in 735.
She was the princess born to Shirakabe no okimi (later the Emperor Konin) in Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in modern Nara) in 733.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Prince Shirakabe→Emperor Konin （光仁天皇）,735→733 と修正しました。
sen.e: She was the princess born to Shirakabe no okimi (later the Emperor Konin) in Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in modern Nara) in 733.

sen.j: 母は高野新笠（『続日本紀』による。
sen.e: Her mother was TAKANO no Niigasa (according to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued).
Her mother was TAKANO no Niigasa (according to "Shoku Nihongi" [Chronicle of Japan Continued].
sen.cmt: 二つ目のカッコを修正しました。（下段のカッコと合わせて大きな一つとなっているため）
sen.e: Her mother was TAKANO no Niigasa (according to "Shoku Nihongi" [Chronicle of Japan Continued].

sen.j: 『本朝皇胤紹運録』では母を井上内親王と記しているが誤伝）。
sen.e: "Honcho koin jounroku" (the Emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period) reported that her mother was the Imperial Princess Inoe, but this is inaccurate information).
"Honcho koin jounroku" (the emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period) has recorded that her mother was the Imperial Princess Inoe, but this is inaccurate information).
sen.cmt: Emperor's→emperor's,reported→has recorded と修正しました。
sen.e: "Honcho koin jounroku" (the emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period) has recorded that her mother was the Imperial Princess Inoe, but this is inaccurate information).

sen.j: 天智天皇皇玄孫（四世王）の市原王（いちはらのおおきみ、いちはらおう）に嫁し、五百井女王（いおいのおおきみ、いおいじょおう、生年不詳）・五百枝王（いおえのおおきみ、いおえおう、760年生まれ、のち春原朝臣の氏姓を賜与され臣籍降下）を儲ける。
sen.e: She married Ichihara no okimi who was a great-great grandson of Emperor Tenchi (fourth generation after Emperor Tenchi) and had Ioi no Joo (year of birth unknown) and Ioe no okimi (born in 760, later he was granted clan and hereditary title of Harubara no Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles) and demoted from the nobility to subject).

She married Ichihara no okimi who was a great-great grandson of the Emperor Tenchi (fourth generation after the Emperor Tenchi) and had Ioi no Joo (year of birth unknown) and Ioe no okimi (born in 760, later he was granted the name of Harubara no Asomi [asomi: second highest of the eight hereditary titles] and demoted from the nobility to subject).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。clan and hereditary title→name,Harubara no Ason→ Harubara no Asomi と修正しました。スペースを修正し、カッコ内のカッコ部分を修正しました。
sen.e: She married Ichihara no okimi who was a great-great grandson of the Emperor Tenchi (fourth generation after the Emperor Tenchi) and had Ioi no Joo (year of birth unknown) and Ioe no okimi (born in 760, later he was granted the name of Harubara no Asomi [asomi: second highest of the eight hereditary titles] and demoted from the nobility to subject).
She lost Ichihara no okimi.
The Ichihara no okimi died and left her.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: The Ichihara no okimi died and left her.
In 770, her father, Shirakabe no okimi ascended to the throne.
In 770, her father, Shirakabe no okimi ascended to the throne.
In 770, her father, Shirakabe no okimi ascended to the throne.

sen.j: 内親王となり、四品に叙せられる。
sen.e: She became Imperial Princess and was granted Shihon (the fourth rank of Imperial Princes' rank).
She became an imperial princess and was conferred Shihon (the fourth rank of Imperial Princes' rank).
sen.cmt: Imperial Princess→an imperial princess,granted→conferred と修正しました。
sen.e: She became an imperial princess and was conferred Shihon (the fourth rank of Imperial Princes' rank).
In 776, she was raised to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank).
In 776, she was raised to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank).
In 776, she was raised to Sanbon (the third rank of the Imperial Princes' rank).
On February 17, 781, her Kokyo (death of a person of upper than Third Rank) confirmed.
On March 20, 781, her Kokyo (death of a person of upper than Third Rank) confirmed.
sen.cmt: 上記の生没年と照らし合わせて、この「781年2月17日」は旧暦であると判断し、修正しました。
sen.e: On March 20, 781, her Kokyo (death of a person of upper than Third Rank) confirmed.
She was granted Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince).
She was granted Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince).
She was granted Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince).

sen.j: 内親王の薨去に際し、光仁天皇は五百井女王・五百枝王を二世王として優遇する詔を発した（本来は五世王であるが、天皇の外孫のため格別に二世王（皇孫）として処遇することにした）。
sen.e: On the death of the Imperial Princess, Emperor Konin issued Imperial edicts elevating Ioi no Joo and Ioe no okimi to the second generation prince and princess (although they were originally the fifth generation princess and prince, they were raised to the second generation because they were the emperor's grandchildren from a daughter married into another family).

On the death of the imperial princess, the Emperor Konin issued the imperial edict promoting Ioi no Joo and Ioe no okimi to the second generation prince and princess (although they were originally the fifth generation princess and prince, they were raised to the second generation (imperial descendant) because they were the emperor's grandchildren from a daughter married into another family).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。Imperial Princess→imperial princess,Imperial edicts→imperial edict, elevating→promoting と修正しました。（皇孫）を補いました。
sen.e: On the death of the imperial princess, the Emperor Konin issued the imperial edict promoting Ioi no Joo and Ioe no okimi to the second generation prince and princess (although they were originally the fifth generation princess and prince, they were raised to the second generation (imperial descendant) because they were the emperor's grandchildren from a daughter married into another family).

sen.j: 内親王薨去後、父天皇も俄かに病気がちとなり、同年4月に譲位、12月に崩御した。
sen.e: After the Imperial princess's death, the emperor, her father was sick a lot and abdicated the throne in April that year and passed away in December.
After the imperial princess's death, the emperor, her father became prone to being sick and abdicated the throne in May that year, and passed away in December.
sen.cmt: Imperial→imperial, was sick a lot→became prone to being sick と修正しました。カンマを補いました。「同年＝内親王が薨去した年＝天応元年（781年）」として、それぞれ4月、12月を西暦に変換しました（12月は同月となります）。
sen.e: After the imperial princess's death, the emperor, her father became prone to being sick and abdicated the throne in May that year, and passed away in December.
